sermons.title: (Youth Bible School 2007) A Holy Nation
sermons.description: Are you a patriot? Are you willing to give your life for your nation? Which one? Really, there's only two choices. God's holy nation, made up of the followers of King Jesus, and the kingdom of this world.

sermons.title: Christ Made Perfect
sermons.description: Major Thomas ask the question, “What saves us, Christ’s death or life?” Very understandable explanations of salvation, justification, sanctification and reconciliation . We are trying to show the world what the church can do for Christ…instead of what Christ can do through the church.

sermons.title: Desert Survival Series Pt 20- Moses The Servant of God
Desert Survival Series Pt 21- Moses The Servant of God
Divine Healing

sermons.title: Jehovah Raphi-The Lord that Heals
sermons.description: The names of God are actually parts of his divine nature, revealed to his children in their times of crisis. When Israel came to the Wilderness of Shur 3 days after crossing the Red Sea, they were thirsty, having used up their water, and immediately began to complain. God supplied the water, but Moses named the place "Marah" meaning bitterness. There are those of God's people who have been hurt and have the root of bitterness in them and God wants to lovingly deal with and remove it lest they be defiled by it. The Lord who heals can mend your broken heart. Part 2 of 8

sermons.title: Making Much Of Jesus
sermons.description: How can we look above the storms of life?  It's by making much of Jesus!  Ralph Sexton preaches the greatness of Jesus and His power, His promises, His preeminence and more.  In tune with his numerous witticisms, he exhorts, "We should be looking for the Upper Taker, not the undertaker."

sermons.title: The Holiness of God
sermons.description: The word holy at it's very core means 'cut' or seperate, God is so far beyond what we think He is like that we cannot truelly concieve of how what He truelly is.  In christianity today we have such a small God that bares little resemblence to the high and lofty One that inhabits eternity.  The Lord said to Moses 'I am that I am' meaning that there is no-one like Him, unlike us when He looks about He see's none like Him, except for a Carpenter who walked the earth 2000 Years ago.  The essence of seperation (holiness) is not what we are seperated from but what or in this case Who, we are seperated to.  There is no point seperating ourselves from the world if we don't then seperate ourselves unto God.

sermons.title: The Signs Of Active Faith
sermons.description: This is a message on the rewards of being totally yielded to God's purposes and how he can use a surrendered vessel to liberate others. The signs are for those who yield to God, who consider it a holy commission to help the lost, seeking his kingdom. Their prayer is "thy kingdom come, thy will be done, in me as it is in heaven, Lord."
